title: Richardson dislocates pinkie on big sack, exits
content: Colts QB Anthony Richardson Sr. dislocated the pinkie on his right (throwing) hand in the first quarter of Thursday night's preseason-opening 24-16 loss to the Ravens and did not return.

title: Texans' Ward arrested in relation to June case
content: Houston safety Jimmie Ward was arrested Thursday because he tested positive for alcohol in violation of the terms of his bail, his lawyer told KPRC 2.

title: Crypto group says it orchestrated sex toy tosses
content: A self-described crypto enthusiast told ESPN that the recent sex toy stunts that have disrupted WNBA games were orchestrated by a group he is involved in.

title: Thomas makes WNBA history with triple-double
content: Alyssa Thomas had 18 points, 11 rebounds and 10 assists to become the first WNBA player with three straight triple-doubles in Phoenix's 95-60 win over Indiana on Thursday night.

title: Skenes allows career-worst 7 hits, still blanks Reds
content: Pirates ace Paul Skenes' record streak of allowing six or fewer hits ended at 46 starts on Thursday night in a 7-0 win over the Reds.

title: Chargers' Slater done for year with patellar tear
content: Star Chargers left tackle Rashawn Slater suffered a season-ending ruptured patellar tendon in practice Thursday, the team said.

title: Mboko, 18, caps Montreal run with 1st WTA title
content: Canadian teen Victoria Mboko rallied to defeat four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka 2-6, 6-4, 6-1 and win the National Bank Open title Thursday night.

title: Ravens rookie CB suffers gruesome knee injury
content: Ravens rookie cornerback Bilhal Kone had his left leg put in an air cast and was carted off after a gruesome knee injury in the preseason opener vs. the Colts.

title: From Ja'Marr Chase to Matt Gay: The 192 players worth rostering in fantasy football
content: Ranking the players who should be drafted in 12-team leagues, divided into tiers, but it can be useful for leagues of all sizes.

title: WNBA trade grades: Report cards for every major deal
content: The Mystics made a second move hours before Thursday's WNBA trade deadline, sending Aaliyah Edwards to the Sun.

title: Bring on the reinforcements! Returning players who could swing MLB's playoff races
content: These injured stars expected to come off the IL could prove as good as any trade deadline blockbuster.

title: How the Browns are navigating a four-way QB competition
content: Amid an unusual preseason with four QBs vying for the top spot, Cleveland has distributed reps in unique ways.

title: When will Cooper Flagg be an All-Star? Projecting the No. 1 pick's NBA future
content: How many MVPs and titles for Cooper Flagg? When can Dallas expect success with him? ESPN experts predict his NBA future.

title: USMNT 2026 World Cup Big Board 1.0: Early picks for Pochettino's team
content: With players focusing on the looming European club season, nine months remain before World Cup squads are announced. Who will be on the U.S.'s?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool eye move for PSG star Bradley Barcola
content: Liverpool could make another blockbuster move to sign Bradley Barcola from Paris Saint-Germain. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Lakers' next era: Fits around Luka, LeBron's future, and why 2027 could change everything
content: The Lakers locked in Luka Doncic. Now what? NBA insiders examine the moves L.A. can and should make to build its next title team.

title: 'Raw end of the stick': Taurasi opens up on being benched for Olympic gold medal game in new documentary
content: A new docuseries sheds light on key parts of the retired star's WNBA, Olympic and overseas basketball career.

title: EA Sports reveals top 10 running backs in Madden NFL 26
content: Jahmyr Gibbs, Christian McCaffrey and others are near the top of Madden NFL 26's running back rankings.

title: Garrett Nussmeier's dad prepared him for the big moments. None will be bigger than 2025
content: The quarterback's dad is the offensive coordinator for the Saints. His mom is from Louisiana. Now, he has a shot to leave his stamp on the state.

title: Transgender athlete debate rolls on six months after executive order
content: Six months after President Trump signed an executive order banning trans women from women's sports, these athletes are still trying to find ways to compete, and battles around their participation continue.

title: UFC Fight Night: Expert picks, best bets for Dolidze vs. Hernandez
content: MMA expert Din Thomas picks Dolidze vs. Hernandez and a betting insider finds value bets on this weekend's MMA cards.

title: Ballon d'Or: 10 nominated players you may have missed since 2014
content: Napoli midfielder Scott McTominay earned himself a place on the short list for the 2025 Ballon d'Or award, but which other under-the-radar players made it over the past decade?

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 11: The final weekend
content: Three teams have clinched playoff bids. Who else will qualify? Here's how the teams line up heading into Boston.

title: Waiver wire: Look to Shepard, Carleton while Collier is out
content: Minnesota's Jessica Shepard and Bridget Carleton are worth adding from the waiver wire following the injury to Lynx star Napheesa Collier.

title: Looking for late-season heroes? Six players to target
content: A lot of teams made strong postseason pushes at the MLB trade deadline. What are you going to do with your team as the fantasy trade deadline approaches?

title: 734 Transactions, 21 Months, 4 Women: Mumbai Man Loses Rs 9 Crore To Cyber Fraud
content: In a scam that spanned nearly two years and 734 online transactions, an 80-year-old man in Mumbai was duped of nearly Rs 9 crore by four women, who could possibly be just one person, in the name of love and sympathy.

title: Uttarakhand Tragedy A Cloudburst Or Glacier Collapse? BJP Leader Weighs In
content: Relief and rescue efforts continue in Uttarakhand's Harsil and Dharali after a cloudburst caused flash floods on Tuesday afternoon. Efforts are on to rebuild the Bailey Bridge at Limchigadh to restore road connectivity.

title: Tesla Shuts Down Dojo Supercomputer Team. Here's Why
content: Tesla Inc. is disbanding its Dojo supercomputer team and its leader will depart the company, according to people familiar with the matter, upending the automaker's effort to develop in-house chips for driverless technology.

title: How ISRO's Satellite Insights Are Helping Uttarkashi Disaster Relief Ops
content: Satellite images, extracted by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), have revealed the scale of destruction caused by the deadly flash floods in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi earlier this week.

title: US Man Accused Of Stealing Rare Chinese Manuscripts Worth $216,000
content: A California library user who allegedly took home rare Chinese manuscripts and returned fake ones in their place has been charged with $216,000-worth of theft, US officials said Thursday.

title: 180 Executions In 6 Months. What's Driving Saudi Arabia's Killing Spree In 2025
content: According to a new Amnesty International report published in July and data from the official Saudi Press Agency, the kingdom has executed 1,816 people between January 2014 and June 2025.

title: Phone Tapping Case: Union Minister Bandi Sanjay Kumar Joins Probe As Witness
content: Union Minister of State for Home Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Friday appeared before a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to provide crucial testimony in the alleged illegal phone tapping during the previous Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) regime in Telangana.

title: Supreme Court Recalls Order Banning High Court Judge From Hearing Criminal Cases
content: The Supreme Court has recalled its order banning an Allahabad High Court judge from hearing criminal cases, following a request from Chief Justice of India BR Gavai.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump, Tughlaq, Tariffs: The Dangers Of Strength Without Sense
content: Like Trump, Tughlaq was often described as an erratic ruler with no shortage of ambition but a chronic inability to foresee the consequences. That's their paradox: strength without strategy, vision without realism.

title: What Trump's New Tariffs Could Mean For US Consumers
content: American businesses and consumers soon will have a better idea of how President Donald Trump's foreign trade agenda might affect them now that the United States has imposed higher tariffs on products from dozens of countries.

title: A Salman Khan Link To Attack On Kapil Sharma's Cafe In Canada
content: Actor-comedian Kapil Sharma was targeted once again, with at least 25 shots being fired at his Kaps Cafe in Canada for the second time in a month.

title: Thane Businessman Cheated Of Rs 4.11 Crore In Forex Trading Scam: Cops
content: A 42-year-old businessman from Maharashtra's Thane city was allegedly duped of Rs 4.11 crore by cyber fraudsters, including foreign nationals, who lured him to invest in a fraudulent forex trading scheme, police said on Friday.

title: 5 Of Family Among 6 Killed As Car Falls Into Gorge In Himachal's Chamba
content: Six people, including five members of a family, were killed on the spot when their car fell 500 metres down into a gorge in Himachal's Chamba district, police said on Friday.

title: Japanese Warships Dock In New Zealand For First Time Since 1936
content: Japanese warships docked in New Zealand's capital Friday for the first time in almost 90 years amid efforts by Tokyo to deepen its strategic ties in the South Pacific Ocean.

title: Woman Has Affair With Husband's Cousin, They Get Him Killed In UP
content: Investigation revealed that it was the victim's wife and her lover, Tasavvur, who had planned to get him killed as he was becoming an 'obstacle' in their relationship, officials said.

title: All You Need To Know About Netanyahu's Plan To Retake Gaza City
content: Israel announced early Friday that it plans to take over Gaza City, the largest urban area in the territory and one that has already suffered extensive devastation in repeated Israeli raids.

title: "Harmful To Our Democracy": BJP Slams Rahul Gandhi Over Poll Fraud Charge
content: The BJP has again hit out at Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi over his explosive claims against the Election Commission (EC) and allegations of voter fraud in the Karnataka elections.

title: Punched, Thrashed: CCTV Shows Moments Before Huma Qureshi's Cousin Was Killed
content: The CCTV recording starts with a young man, one of the accused, walking towards Asif Qureshi and charging at him. The two began pushing each other while trying to defend themselves. A woman tries to mediate but is pushed aside.

title: US India Tariff LIVE Updates: UN "Disheartened" by Trump Tariffs, India Mulls Help For Exporters
content: US Trade Tariffs LIVE News Updates: US President Donald Trump this week announced tariffs totalling a punitive 50 per cent on Indian imports over its trade with Russia, bringing a jarring stop to a period of broadly warming US-India relations.

title: Gurugram Woman Creates Fake Instagram Profile, Sends Death Threats To Husband
content: A woman has been arrested in Gurugram for allegedly creating a fake Instagram account to send death threats to her husband and herself.

title: 'Sign declaration or apologise': EC counters Rahul over 'vote chori' claim
content: The Election Commission confronts Rahul Gandhi over electoral fraud claims. They demand he signs a declaration supporting his allegations. Alternatively, the commission wants an apology. Gandhi alleges vote manipulation in Karnataka. He accuses the EC of colluding with the BJP. The EC denies destroying evidence. They state Gandhi failed to respond to earlier requests for proof.

title: ‘Mumbai next’: Gangsters' warning after firing at Kapil Sharma’s Canada café
content: Kapil Sharma's cafe in Surrey, Canada, was targeted by gunfire for the second time in a month, with 9-10 shots fired, thankfully causing no injuries. A social media post, purportedly from an associate of Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar, claimed responsibility, threatening further action in Mumbai.

title: Huma Qureshi's cousin murdered: Chilling visuals from crime scene emerge
content: Asif Qureshi, relative of Bollywood actor Huma Qureshi, was murdered in Delhi. The incident occurred after a parking dispute in Jangpura’s Bhogal Bazar Lane. CCTV footage showed a heated argument escalating into a physical attack. Two brothers, Gautam and Ujjwal, have been arrested. Ujjwal initiated the attack. Police have registered a murder case. Investigation is currently underway.

title: Cricket: Kohli’s 2018 masterclass vs England still outshines Gill’s run-fest in 2025
content: Shubman Gill's stellar performance in the drawn Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy has sparked comparisons with Virat Kohli's 2018 tour. Gill amassed 754 runs, surpassing Kohli's series total, but Kohli's innings was played in tougher conditions. While Gill's series was exceptional, Kohli's resilience in 2018 remains a testament to his fighting spirit.

title: 'Only Tamil and English to continue': Stalin rolls out new education policy for TN
content: Tamil Nadu CM M.K. Stalin has unveiled the state's new education policy, crafted in response to the Centre's National Education Policy (NEP). The state government strongly opposes the NEP, viewing it as a Hindi imposition and against social justice.

title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman at GPT-5 launch: India is our second-largest market
content: OpenAI has launched GPT-5, its most advanced AI model, boasting significant improvements in accuracy, speed, and reasoning. CEO Sam Altman highlighted India as a rapidly growing market, potentially surpassing the US. GPT-5 is available in various sizes and tiers, including a free version, with enhanced versions for Team, Enterprise, Edu, and Pro users, marking a step towards Artificial General Intelligence.

title: With Trump’s 50% tariffs looming, India reviews market access offer to US
content: Despite increased US tariffs on crude oil trade with Russia, India is reassessing its market access offers to the US, aiming to finalize a trade deal this month. While committed to protecting its agricultural and dairy sectors, India is exploring improvements in other areas.

title: After 2-2 vs India, McGrath predicts 5-0 Ashes win for Australia
content: Glenn McGrath predicted a 5-0 Ashes sweep for Australia, citing England's batting weaknesses exposed during their recent series against India. He anticipated Australia's strong pace attack, led by Cummins, Starc, Hazlewood, and Lyon, will dominate England's top order, particularly Root and Brook. McGrath acknowledged Australia's top-order concerns but believed England's bowling needs improvement to compete effectively in Australian conditions.

title: SC deletes observations on its order rapping HC judge
content: The Supreme Court retracted two paragraphs from its August 4th order concerning Justice Prashant Kumar of the Allahabad High Court. This followed concerns raised by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai regarding remarks perceived as demeaning.

title: 'Democracy too precious': Tharoor backs Rahul's 'vote chori' claim
content: Tharoor further said, "Our democracy is too precious to allow its credibility to be destroyed by incompetence, carelessness or worse, deliberate tampering. Election Commission must urgently act & should keep the nation informed."

title: CEO tip: Google's Sundar Pichai to youngsters: I believe that best employees are…
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, now a billionaire, emphasizes the importance of self-criticism and embracing discomfort for professional growth. He encourages Gen Z to pursue their passions and work with individuals who challenge their abilities. Pichai's management philosophy centers on building mission-oriented teams driven by a shared pursuit of excellence, fostering an environment of trust and commitment.

title: Don't pick on Jasprit Bumrah - Why pacer's body can't fight every battle
content: Debate surrounds Jasprit Bumrah's absence from the fifth Test against England, despite Mohammed Siraj's impressive performance securing a 2-2 series draw. Questions arise about workload management versus national duty, fueled by Sunil Gavaskar's remarks. While Bumrah's past commitment, including playing through pain in Australia, is acknowledged, his IPL participation and future T20 World Cup aspirations add complexity.

title: Heartbreak on Assam highway: Crippled jumbo forced to trek 95km
content: A 48-year-old injured elephant, Maniki, was forced to walk nearly 95km for medical care in Assam, sparking public outrage. Her owner ignored orders to transport her, leading to intervention by locals and authorities. Maniki is now receiving medical attention and will be transported for advanced treatment.

title: First planned migration: Tuvalu to shift to Australia; here’s why
content: Tuvalu, a Pacific island nation, faces imminent submersion due to rising sea levels, prompting a groundbreaking planned migration. A treaty with Australia allows 280 Tuvaluans annually to gain permanent residency, accessing essential services.

title: 17 years after father’s murder, youth hacks dad’s killer to death
content: In Chennai, Yuvanesh, a 19-year-old college student, avenged his father's murder by killing Raj Kumar, the original perpetrator. The 2008 murder of Yuvanesh's father fueled a long-standing grudge, recently ignited by Raj Kumar's taunts. Yuvanesh, along with two associates, attacked Raj Kumar at his home, leading to his death.

title: Vote 'chori' charge: Rahul drops new video on how Congress investigated; reveals what the data shows
content: Rahul Gandhi has escalated his criticism of the Election Commission, releasing a video alleging widespread irregularities and "vote theft" in multiple state elections. He questions the EC's neutrality, citing discrepancies between perceived public sentiment and election results. Gandhi specifically points to Maharashtra, claiming a surge in new voters favoring the BJP and the EC's refusal to provide requested data.

title: 'You killed children': Palestinian woman confronts ex-IDF soldier. How he responded
content: A heated confrontation erupted on a New York beach when an anti-Israel activist targeted a former Israeli soldier wearing a Star of David necklace. The activist aggressively accused him of war crimes and killing children in Gaza, as documented by ILTV Israel News.

title: Chamba tragedy: 6 dead as car crushed by boulders
content: A tragic accident in Chamba district, Himachal Pradesh, claimed six lives late Thursday night. Boulders struck a car carrying a family of four and two others near Chanvas village, causing it to plunge into a deep gorge. Among the deceased were a school teacher, his wife, and their two children. Rescue operations faced challenges due to the remote location.

title: Trump retirement investing overhaul: WH order opens 401(k)s to pvt equity, crypto
content: President Trump's executive order aims to broaden 401(k) investment options, potentially including private equity and cryptocurrency. This shift directs federal agencies to revise regulations under ERISA, allowing employers to offer alternative assets in retirement plans. While proponents tout higher returns, concerns remain regarding volatility, fees, and liquidity, prompting industry groups to urge caution and careful implementation.

title: 'We don't want to keep it, but ... ': Israel announces plan to take over Gaza; what it means
content: Benjamin Netanyahu says Israel plans military control of Gaza. Israel does not want to govern it. The 2005 withdrawal may be reversed. Some Israeli military leaders disagree with expanding the war. Arab countries are not agreeing to govern Gaza. Protests are growing in Israel for hostage release. The UN is deeply alarmed by reports. The situation in Gaza remains dire.

title: ‘Move the scooter’: How parking spat killed actor Huma Qureshi’s cousin in Delhi
content: In Delhi's Nizamuddin area, a dispute over a parked scooter tragically escalated, resulting in the death of Huma Qureshi's cousin, Asif Qureshi. The altercation, which began when Asif asked two men to move their scooter, turned violent, leading to a fatal attack. Police have arrested two brothers in connection with the murder, as investigations continue into this shocking incident.

title: Trade war: Trump's 50% 'penalty' tariffs threaten India's manufacturing goals, warns Moody's
content: Moody's warns that US tariffs doubling to 50% on Indian goods, due to continued Russian oil purchases, could significantly hinder India's manufacturing ambitions and investment inflows. This may slow GDP growth by 0.3% in FY2025-26.

title: Mud in lungs, stones in throats: Uttarkashi cloudburst leaves villagers in trauma
content: Rescue operations in Dharali and Harsil reveal the extent of injuries sustained by villagers and Army personnel, with many battling trauma in Uttarakhand hospitals. Victims suffered severe blunt force injuries, fractures, and lung damage from being swept away by a cloudburst. Doctors extracted mud and stones from deep within patients' bodies.

title: Tyreek Hill and ex-wife Keeta Vaccaro rush baby Capri to ER; now recovering
content: Tyreek Hill's eight-month-old daughter, Capri, was rushed to the emergency room after developing alarming symptoms, causing significant concern for her mother, Keeta Vaccaro. Doctors swiftly stabilized Capri, and her condition improved by sunrise. Despite ongoing family turmoil, the outpouring of support from fans highlights the shared relief and gratitude for Capri's recovery.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 goes below 24,500; BSE Sensex down 500 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday as Donald Trump’s 50% tariffs on India and its likely impact on exports and economy hit sentiment.

title: Masaba Gupta once slammed Ramiz Raja for laughing at racist joke about her parents
content: Masaba Gupta, fashion designer and actor, condemned Ramiz Raja for laughing at a racist joke. The joke targeted her father, Vivian Richards, and mother, Neena Gupta, on a Pakistani TV show. The comedian made derogatory remarks about Richards' skin color and his relationship with Gupta. Masaba called out Raja on Twitter, criticizing his lack of grace.

title: Cricket | When did Shreyas Iyer last play for India in T20Is and Tests?
content: Shreyas Iyer is strongly considered for a comeback to India's T20I and Test squads for the Asia Cup and West Indies series, respectively. Despite being overlooked for the England tour, his recent performances, including a strong showings in the Ranji Trophy for Mumbai and ICC Champions Trophy, have bolstered his chances.

title: 'Wish Zora was here': Dhawan's heartfelt message for son melts fans' hearts
content: Former India cricketer Shikhar Dhawan's recent Instagram post, featuring unseen photos with his son Zoraver, has resonated deeply with fans. Dhawan expressed his longing for his son, especially after seeing his friends with their children. The post included a picture with Rohit Sharma and his daughter, highlighting the family bonds within cricket.

title: 'Do you allow daughters to leave hostel at any time': PU form sparks row
content: Panjab University's new declaration form for girls' hostel residents, requiring parental consent for 24x7 access, has sparked controversy. Students fear it undermines their autonomy and reinstates control despite the 2018 protests that secured equal mobility rights. The university defends the form as a means to inform parents, but student groups argue it infringes on hard-won freedoms.

title: ‘Fair-skinned newborns up to Rs 5 lakh’: Ghaziabad police bust gang selling babies
content: Police in Ghaziabad busted a child trafficking ring, arresting four individuals, including two marriage bureau owners from Muzaffarnagar and Shamli. The gang allegedly abducted and sold fair-skinned newborns for up to Rs 5 lakh to childless couples across states.

title: 'Dad, I still haven't found a place': Easwaran's father reveals emotional chat after snub
content: Abhimanyu Easwaran's father revealed his son's frustration at not being selected for a single Test match during the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, despite strong performances beforehand. Easwaran, though disappointed, is now focused on preparing for the Duleep Trophy. Encouragement from head coach Gautam Gambhir, promising him a fair opportunity, has helped maintain his spirits.

title: Ahaan starrer draws plagiarism claims: Saiyaara writer speaks out; ‘Watch both and judge yourself’
content: Mohit Suri’s Saiyaara is basking in box office glory, having grossed over Rs 500 crore globally. But even as the romantic drama continues to draw audiences, a cloud of controversy has loomed over its success. A section of viewers has accused the film of being lifted from the Korean classic A Moment To Remember. Now, the film’s writer Sankalp Sadanah has addressed the allegations head-on.

title: 50% US tariffs on India: More trade talks ahead? Trump was asked; here’s how he responded
content: President Trump declared that the U.S. will not engage in trade negotiations with India until the existing tariff dispute is resolved. This decision follows the U.S. imposing a 50% tariff on Indian exports, citing concerns over India's trade imbalance and continued purchase of Russian oil.

title: Bengaluru: Human body parts found in 5 locations across city, head missing
content: A gruesome discovery unfolded near Chimpaganahalli in Tumakuru as a stray dog was spotted carrying a severed human arm, leading to the discovery of mutilated body parts scattered across multiple locations. Police are investigating the chilling murder, deploying forensic teams and dog squads to piece together the crime scene.

title: Legionnaires’ disease and air conditioning: A risk you probably didn’t know about
content: Legionnaires' disease, a severe pneumonia caused by Legionella bacteria, thrives in stagnant water within large air conditioning systems. The disease spreads through contaminated water droplets, leading to symptoms like fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Prevention relies on regular AC maintenance, water system flushing, and biocide treatments, especially in hotels and public buildings.

title: Who is Haider Ali? Pakistan cricketer arrested in England on rape charge
content: Haider Ali, a young Pakistan cricketer, has been arrested in England amidst the Shaheens' tour, facing allegations of rape. Greater Manchester Police are investigating the incident, which reportedly occurred on July 23, 2025. The PCB has provisionally suspended Ali and pledged full cooperation with the legal proceedings, casting a shadow over his promising career.

title: Wanted burglar ‘Bombay Saleem’ wears police uniform in hotel room, video calls wife
content: A constable in Bengaluru has been suspended after a burglary accused, Saleem alias Bombay Saleem, was found to have made a video call to his wife while in custody, wearing the constable's uniform. The incident surfaced when Indiranagar police arrested Saleem in connection with another case and discovered the video on his phone.

title: India still a ‘strategic partner’? US vows 'frank' talks
content: Despite escalating trade tensions and disagreements over energy policy, the United States maintains that India remains a crucial strategic partner. The State Department emphasized the need for open dialogue to resolve concerns, including trade imbalances and India's Russian oil purchases.

title: Selena Gomez on Taylor Swift: Travis Kelce splits from Blake Lively — friendship fallout
content: Amidst personal changes, Taylor Swift's friendship with Blake Lively reportedly ended due to legal issues involving Justin Baldoni. Selena Gomez discussed her long-standing bond with Swift, revealing their shared history of dating Jonas Brothers. Swift and Kelce are expected at Gomez's wedding. Swift has been seen reconnecting with Gomez, while distancing herself from Lively and Ryan Reynolds.

title: Canadian police arrest man months after Indian student killed
content: Jerdaine Foster, 32, has been arrested and charged with first-degree murder in the fatal shooting of Harsimrat Randhawa, a 21-year-old Indian student in Niagara Falls. Randhawa, an innocent bystander, was struck by a stray bullet while returning from the gym. The shooting, involving multiple individuals and vehicles, is connected to another similar case, offering some relief to the affected communities.

title: Trump tariffs: To beat 50% duty, exporters speed up US consignments
content: Indian exporters are accelerating shipments to the US ahead of an August 27 deadline, fearing a duty hike to 50%. A three-way split of the initial 25% tariff is in place, but concerns remain, especially for smaller businesses with less bargaining power.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Recommendations for August 8 - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Amidst US tariff tensions, Indian markets show volatility, with Nifty finding support at 24,400-24,500 and Bank Nifty between 55,200-54,900. Bajaj Broking suggests accumulating fundamentally strong stocks during this correction. Top picks include JSW Energy, poised for a breakout targeting ₹598, and Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL), expected to reach ₹4870.

title: Pakistan: Asim Munir to visit US a second time in 2 months
content: Field Marshal Asim Munir's second US visit in two months highlights strengthening military ties between Pakistan and the US, amidst domestic political divisions. He will attend General Kurilla's farewell ceremony, following Kurilla's Pakistan trip. Despite protests from Imran Khan's supporters, the US seeks to re-engage with Pakistan's military due to regional instability.

title: 'Captain Cool meets Music Sensation’: Watch Dhoni play padel with Anirudh
content: MS Dhoni launched his sports venture, 7Padel, in Chennai, highlighted by a friendly padel match with music composer Anirudh Ravichander. The facility features padel and pickleball courts, a pool, gym, and more. Dhoni aims to popularize padel, emphasizing its accessibility for all, hoping 7Padel becomes a hub for athletes and families in Chennai.

title: Typos, technicalities used to deny citizenship claims in Assam: Report
content: A new report scrutinizes the legal processes of Foreigners Tribunals and the Gauhati High Court in Assam, revealing that over 1.6 lakh people were declared "foreigners" based on minor discrepancies in documents and dismissed oral testimonies. The report highlights how crucial documents were rejected due to formatting flaws and inconsistencies, leading to a burgeoning crisis of rights violations and exclusion.

title: ED need not act like crook while probing crooks: SC
content: The Supreme Court cautioned the Enforcement Directorate (ED) against employing unlawful tactics during PMLA investigations, emphasizing adherence to legal procedures. Justices highlighted the low conviction rate in ED's PMLA cases, suggesting the establishment of fast-track courts to expedite trials. The court also addressed concerns about cryptocurrency's potential for money laundering, advocating for its regulation.

title: No Board exam for Class 11 students in Tamil Nadu from this year
content: This is as per the State Education Policy - School Education released by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin in Chennai

title: Opposition MPs protest against SIR, 'vote theft' in Parliament complex
content: Several MPs also carried posters and placards alleging "vote theft", alluding to the poll rigging claims made by Leader of Opposition in the Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi at a press conference on Thursday, August 7.

title: Serious questions which must be addressed, ECI must act: Tharoor on Rahul's poll rigging claims
content: Our democracy is too precious to allow its credibility to be destroyed by incompetence, carelessness or worse, deliberate tampering, says Congress MP Shashi Tharoor

title: House gutted after power bank explodes in Kerala
content: Aboobakker Siddique, an autorickshaw driver, and his family had gone out while the power bank was plugged in for charging at the house. The neighbours rushed to the spot as they saw the fire spreading, accompanied by a loud noise

title: Plea in SC says BNS has ‘repackaged’ colonial sedition law; Bench seeks Centre’s reply
content: Petition says Section 152 is violative of fundamental rights under Articles 14 (equality), 19(1)(a) (free speech), and 21 (right to life and personal liberty) of the Constitution.

title: Visually impaired wild tusker PT-5 tranquilised in Kerala’s Palakkad for treatment
content: 15-member special taskforce, with the help of two Kumki elephants, are making efforts to bring PT-5 out of forests to provide appropriate treatment

title: Bihar govt sets up board to protect transgender community's rights
content: The government is trying to provide them an atmosphere where they feel protected and live a respectful life like any other citizen in the country, says Social Welfare Department Secretary Bandana Preyashi

title: ECI asking Rahul Gandhi to submit complaint on Karnataka roll manipulation under oath infructuous in this situation: experts
content: According to Constitution Law expert P.D.T. Achary, “These rules do not apply in this situation and these rules apply till 30 days after draft rolls are published”

title: CM Stalin releases Tamil Nadu’s State policy for school education; reiterates two-language formula
content: The policy has been designed in view of Tamil Nadu’s unique character and is aimed at preparing students for the future with a vision, Mr. Stalin said

title: Reliance Infra to recover $2.44 billion in unpaid power dues from Delhi consumers
content: The Delhi Electricity Regulatory Commission will oversee the recovery process, which is expected to result in increased electricity bills for consumers in Delhi.

title: SIR 'institutionalised chori'; ECI colluding with BJP to carry out 'vote theft': Rahul
content: We have caught just one method, we have not probed other methods. I am telling the EC and its officials clearly that what you are doing is not right. This is treason against the country, says Congress leader  Rahul Gandhi

title: Imposition of additional duty on India ‘national security issue’: White House trade adviser
content: Peter Navarro said it is important to understand that the “rationale for the India tariffs is very different from the reciprocal tariffs”

title: Evacuation of pilgrims underway in disaster-hit Uttarkashi, 6 more rescued safely
content: Advanced equipment required to dredge through the mounds of debris in Dharali are being flown to the spot with the help of IAF's Chinook and Mi-17 helicopters and those of Uttarakhand Civil Aviation Authority.

title: Jain Samaj stages protest in Belagavi seeking return of elephant to mutt
content: A participant said that ‘if the government was worried about ill-treatment, it should have shifted the animal to a public rehabilitation centre or zoo, and not a private facility set by a corporate entity’

title: Dharmasthala burials: SIT to hire ground penetrating device to search for bodies at site No. 13
content: According to SIT sources, the complainant has told them that skeletal remains could be found at a depth of 20 feet at site No. 13, on which stands an electricity transformer

title: ‘Vote Adhikar Rally’ LIVE: Rahul Gandhi in Bengaluru to participate in Congress protest over ‘vote theft’
content: The party has alleged electoral fraud during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections in Karnataka based on its study of the Mahadevapura Assembly segment

title: PM Modi's claim of special relationship with Trump stands totally exposed: Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh pointed out that since January 2025, the U.S. does not have a regular Ambassador in New Delhi nor has it named anyone yet for confirmation by the U.S. Senate — unlike for other key countries like China

title: Interest in Belagavi District Central Co-operative Bank polls rivals that of general elections
content: The main contenders are BJP leaders who are now in rival camps as far as elections to the bank are concerned

title: Parliament Monsoon Session Day 15 LIVE: Lok Sabha adjourned till 3 p.m., Rajya Sabha wraps up for the day amid Opposition protests
content: Union Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya is set to move the National Sports Governance Bill of 2025 for consideration and passage on Friday.

title: Shots fired at Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Canada, second time in a month
content: Kapil Sharma and his team have not issued any statement yet; a few hours after the incident, a viral social media post allegedly shared by gangster Goldy Dhillon claimed responsibility.

title: Silent killer in paradise village: Chronic kidney disorders in Andhra Pradesh’s Bhadrayyapeta
content: An alarming number of residents suffer from chronic kidney disorders in a sleepy little village near Visakhapatnam city. Almost every household has at least one member battling a renal issue. The residents blame the water supplied through the sole community tap in the village while officials point out shortcomings in cleanliness and improper medication, reports Harish Gilai

title: Casinos to crypto: how cybercriminals launder money
content: Recovering money swindled from victims in cyber crimes is already a herculean task. The Hindu reports on the recent trends which show how cyber criminal networks are colluding with other networks like casinos, online betting apps and crypto currency exchanges to launder money, complicating the money trail.

title: India monsoon LIVE: Heavy rain triggers waterlogging, traffic snarls in Hyderabad
content: Amid the ongoing monsoon season, many States are experiencing heavy rainfall, which has led to flooding and waterlogging in several parts of the country

title: More women than men deleted from electoral rolls in Bihar during SIR: Data
content: It is concerning that more women have been deleted from the rolls, given that men out-migrate more from the State

title: RMC predicts heavy rainfall over North Tamil Nadu this week; wet spell to continue till August 13
content: The rainfall, which was active in the delta and Western Ghats districts until a few days ago, would cover north Tamil Nadu this week.

title: Over 16,000 Bengali speakers screened in Delhi to identify illegal Bangladeshis
content: The police sent multiple teams to labour chowks, informal housing clusters of migrant workers and transit hubs to conduct verification drives of the Bengali speakers inhabiting those locations

title: West Bengal BJP MPs meet ECI, flag ‘threats’ to State election officials
content: This development unfolds amidst an ongoing campaign by the Bengal BJP for the removal of ‘foreign infiltrators and fake voters’ from the State’s electoral rolls, and their allegations against the Trinamool government for allegedly curbing election officials from discharging their duties

title: In Telangana’s tribal hamlets, shipping containers are health centres
content: In the remote corners of Mulugu, where dense forests and inaccessible terrain have long deprived people of basic healthcare and education, the district administration with active support of Minister Seethakka is piloting a first-of-its-kind solution in Telangana: repurposed shipping containers transformed into healthcare centres and classrooms. P. Laxma Reddy highlights how the initiative, already drawing interest from neighbouring Andhra Pradesh, is bridging critical service gaps in areas the State has historically struggled to reach

title: No affordable housing project under revamped PMAY-U 2.0 submitted so far by A.P., says Union Minister
content: These projects are eligible for ₹90.64 crore assistance under Technology Innovation Grant, says Tokhan Sahu

title: NDA govt. stopped all welfare schemes for weavers, says Jagan
content: Sixteen months have passed by, but the government has failed to reimburse GST and provide free power to the weavers, he alleges

title: 25,807 cases registered under ‘Operation Safe Campus Zone’ in A.P.
content: ‘Operation Safe Campus Zone’ aims at preventing the sale of cigarettes and illicit drugs within 100 yards of educational institutions, says DGP Harish Gupta

title: Former BPSL promoters argue against liquidation in SC
content: The former promoters of BPSL sought a fresh corporate insolvency resolution process to be initiated if JSW’s resolution plan was found faulty

title: Not until we get it resolved: Trump on trade negotiations with India
content: A U.S. team was scheduled to visit India on August 25 for the next round of negotiations for the proposed bilateral trade agreement

title: Nellore Municipal Corporation intensifies crackdown on unauthorised constructions
content: Town Planning officials demolish three buildings in Venkataramapuram and James Garden areas that had additional floors built in violation of rules

title: SC to again hear case in which it had rebuked High Court judge for ‘absurd’ order
content: The apex court had taken stern exception to an Allahabad High Court judge finding nothing wrong in a litigant filing a criminal case against a buyer in a purely civil dispute

title: ISRO assesses Dharali damage post flash flood
content: The space agency said the findings include indications of flash flood, with widened stream channels, altered river morphology and damage to human lives and infrastructure

title: 13 Allahabad High Court judges urge Chief Justice to not follow Supreme Court’s directive
content: The apex court has barred an Allahabad High Court judge from hearing criminal cases until his retirement

title: Amid Trump's tariff tirade, Brazilian President dials PM Modi; both leaders agree to boost ties
content: PM Modi and the Brazilian President also exchanged views on regional and global issues of mutual interest, the Prime Minister's Office (PMO) said

title: The fear of losing a school: on U.P. school merger plan
content: With Uttar Pradesh initiating the process of merging over 10,000 primary schools with low attendance, anxiety grips families that can only afford government schooling. Mayank Kumar reports on their worries: distances, tough terrain, and safety, all of which may force people with low income and mobility to take their children, especially the girls, out of school

title: HC pauses Punjab’s land pooling policy; govt. to file reply within 4 weeks
content: Court grants interim stay on operation of policy, questions State govt. over not conducting Social Impact Assessment; will launch stir on Sept. 1 and it will continue until policy is withdrawn: Badal

title: CUMTA takes up study to assess gaps in last-mile connectivity
content: The CUMTA carried out 13 types of surveys among commuters of suburban trains, Metro Rail, and MTC buses. It aims to re-organise bus routes to cater to highly populated areas, by identifying the primary, secondary, and other corridors

title: Special photo exhibition at RIFFK showcases MT’s cinematic journey
content: The exhibition has been curated by film historian and photographer R. Gopalakrishnan and showcases over 100 rare photographs

title: The Bihar migrant worker, a Scylla-Charybdis moment
content: The issues around the disenfranchisement of migrant voters are complex, which the Supreme Court must consider when it passes its orders

title: Candidates get provisional allotment to colleges displaying ‘zero’ intake during second round of counselling for TNEA
content: At least 36 students were given provisional allotment to five engineering colleges that displayed ‘zero’ seat availability during Round 2 on the TNEA website, although they had displayed their full sanctioned seat availability during Round 1

title: Long-standing critical vacancies in government hospitals filled through online counselling system in transfers, says Minister Dinesh Gundu Rao
content: ‘Critical vacancies such as gynaecologists, anesthesiologists and paediatricians — an essential triad for comprehensive maternal health services — have now been filled in a majority of  locations’

title: Christians living in insecure conditions in BJP-ruled States, says Syro-Malabar Church media commission
content: Church protest against an attack on priests and nuns in Gangadhar village of Jaleswar in Odisha by  Bajrang Dal activists

title: If EC cannot prove Rahul Gandhi wrong, then Commission should dissolve itself: CPI
content: The EC’s job is to ensure that elections are held free and fair in this country and a constitutional body that cannot fulfil this obligation should make way for others, says Binoy Viswam

title: From Kannur looms to Prime Minister’s wardrobe: handwoven Onakkodi heads to Delhi
content: This is the third time Loknath Weavers is making Onakkodi for the Prime Minister. They will make nine unique kurta patterns for him and seven Union Ministers. The fabric is crafted in twill weave, a technique that demands much patience

title: INDIA bloc decides to contest the Vice-Presidential polls
content: At its first physical meet in 14 months, a select group of INDIA bloc leaders has decided that despite not having the requisite numbers to win, it won’t give the government a walkover in the Presidential polls

title: Rajya Sabha passes Coastal Shipping Bill amid disruptions
content: Union Minister Sarbananda Sonowal said the legislation will reduce the compliance burden for Indian ships and will unlock the full potential of country’s coastline

title: Yogi Adityanath vows to restore 68 shrines, 19 sacred wells allegedly destroyed by invaders in Sambhal
content: U.P. CM says Sambhal’s religious heritage can be revived as was done in Ayodhya and Kashi; alleges “malicious conspiracy” behind attempt to erase truth of desecration by invaders

title: IndiGo to again connect Belagavi with New Delhi, Bengaluru
content: Indigo to operate daily flights between Belagavi and New Delhi from September 16, and from Belagavi to Bengaluru from September 21

title: ‘Impeachment’ not the only route to act against judges for misconduct in office: Supreme Court
content: Bench interpreted Section 3(2) of the Judges (Protection) Act to provide legal sanction to the in-house inquiry procedure and to empower CJI with a legal authority over High Court judges facing serious allegations of misconduct

title: Maharashtra govt. wants CBFC to re-examine certification for Khalid ka Shivaji, halt release of movie
content: Congress slams BJP move, says Shivaji being reduced to ‘Hindutva icon’, asks State government why it is disturbed if Muslims identify with the values of the warrior king

title: Uncovering ancient rock art and forgotten histories of Telangana villages
content: What began as accidental finds by farmers is now a growing citizen-led movement, powered by maps and Whatsapp, to conserve Telangana’s archaeological heritage

title: No Central nod for private participation in mining of atomic minerals, clarifies ministry
content: ‘Operating rights for atomic minerals are granted only to the government, government companies, or corporations and not to private entities’

title: Uttarkashi flash floods: Anxious families wait for updates from Dharali as rescue efforts continue
content: With communication down and power supply cut, families at rescue centres and Uttarkashi district headquarters say they have not been able to establish contact ever since flash flood struck

title: CPI demands investigation into ‘electoral fraud’ in Thrissur Lok Sabha polls
content: CPI leader V.S. Sunilkumar, who came second in the 2024 Thrissur LS election, says LDF’s accusations of voter fraud had assumed gravity in the wake of Rahul Gandhi flagging tens of thousands of of fake voters in constituencies bagged by the BJP in many States

title: BJP president Nadda condemns attack on Bengal LoP Suvendu Adhikari’s convoy in Cooch Behar
content: Several vehicles including the one in which the LOP was travelling in, were allegedly attacked with stones at Khagrabari in Cooch Behar district on August 5. The windshields and rear glass panes of some vehicles were shattered.

title: Chapters on war heroes Manekshaw, Usman, Somnath added to NCERT textbooks: Defence Ministry
content: The newly introduced chapters aim to provide students with inspirational narratives on courage and duty

title: On Election Commission fraud claims, BJP accuses Rahul Gandhi of ‘selective outrage’
content: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan says by attacking the EC, Rahul has insulted the discerning decision of the public; BJP MP and spokesperson Sambit Patra too lashes out at Congress leader

title: FTCCI wants TG govt. to shield exporters, says State support vital
content: Trade licence fee tweaks for some, exemption for others, speedy release of incentives and subsidies on logistics measures the trade and industry body listed in a representation to Industries and IT Minister

title: Reservoir levels in A.P. show marked improvement this year
content: Nellore, Kadapa and Palnadu districts report the highest storage, while Visakhapatnam, Chittoor, and Tirupati have limited levels

title: Cabinet clears Karnataka Devadasi Bill for rehabilitation, 17 other Bills
content: The Bill provides the option for children of a Devadasi not to be compelled to declare the name of their father while applying for government identity cards, says Minister for Law and Parliamentary Affairs

title: J&K: Terrorist hideout busted in Baramulla; cache of arms and ammunition seized
content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: SEC football preview: Power Rankings, top players, must-see games
content: Texas, Georgia and Alabama all enter the season with new starting quarterbacks . arch Manning is under some very bright lights as we wait to see if he lives up to the hype . former Washington State quarterback John Mateer joins Oklahoma this fall .

title: Is it time to worry about Caleb Williams and the Bears?
content: a week 1 loss for Caleb Williams and the Bears would go over in Chicago . his emotional reaction was caught on video by fans during an open practice . the frustration reflects Williams' competitive nature while dealing with the ups and downs of learning a complicated new offense .

title: U.S.'s Shelton rallies to win Toronto final in three sets
content: Ben Shelton wins the national bank open for the third and biggest title of his young career . shelton beats 11th-seeded Karen Khachanov of Russia 6-7 (5), 6-4, 7-6 (3) . the 22-year-old becomes the first american to win any Masters 1000 title since 2003 .

title: Latest news, buzz from all 32 NFL training camps: Who are the stars of the summer so far?
content: our 32 team reporters have been on the ground every day following the action . we have updated 32 files with all the latest details . ARI | ATL | BAL | BUF | CAR | CHI | CIN CLE | cin cle | chris christian .

title: Big Ten football preview: Power rankings, top players, key games
content: the college football season is less than a month away . we break down the conference's CFP outlook, power rankings, must-see games, top freshmen, key transfers and numbers to know . defending national champion Ohio State always will be penciled into the field .

title: Nailing preseason is key to any club's Premier League ambitions
content: the first day of preseason is perhaps the most positive moment of the entire year for professional footballers . it's the start of a new journey, but preseason also marks a return of stress and hard work . the timing and requirements are changing, and players are putting in so much work in the offseason .

title: 136 teams and a tier for every college football program: Where does your team rank?
content: committees get it wrong nearly every year despite the fact that they've mostly gotten it right . reporters and coaches don't have the time to watch the games . if humans can't rank college football teams, it's just a matter of time be a species .

title: Power Rankings: Who's the best team in baseball right now?
content: the Phillies sit at no. 1 for the third consecutive week . the Yankees have dropped five straight games since July 31 . they have fallen to their lowest ranking of the season at No. 12 . but the red sox have won seven of their last eight games .

title: NFL preseason Week 1 takeaways: Seahawks' Milroe flashes potential; Ravens' Wester dazzles in debut
content: the 2025 preseason kicks off with several rookies playing their first snaps . a play from Jalen Milroe 's NFL debut showed exactly how he can help the Seahawks' offense this season .
